intro: Paraboea tiumanica, commonly known as the Tiumanica paraboea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its trailing stems and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. Its leaves are typically opposite and ovate, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Paraboea tiumanica is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
